member.name: T:SQLite.SQLiteConnection
member.summary: Represents an open connection to a SQLite database.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructs a new SQLiteConnection and opens a SQLite database specified by databasePath.
member.param: Specifies the path to the database file.

Specifies whether to store DateTime properties as ticks (true) or strings (false). You absolutely do want to store them as Ticks in all new projects. The value of false is only here for backwards compatibility. There is a *significant* speed advantage, with no down sides, when setting storeDateTimeAsTicks = true. If you use DateTimeOffset properties, it will be always stored as ticks regardingless the storeDateTimeAsTicks parameter.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.#ctor(System.String,SQLite.SQLiteOpenFlags,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructs a new SQLiteConnection and opens a SQLite database specified by databasePath.
member.param: Specifies the path to the database file.
Flags controlling how the connection should be opened.

Specifies whether to store DateTime properties as ticks (true) or strings (false). You absolutely do want to store them as Ticks in all new projects. The value of false is only here for backwards compatibility. There is a *significant* speed advantage, with no down sides, when setting storeDateTimeAsTicks = true. If you use DateTimeOffset properties, it will be always stored as ticks regardingless the storeDateTimeAsTicks parameter.

member.name: P:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.BusyTimeout
member.summary: Sets a busy handler to sleep the specified amount of time when a table is locked. The handler will sleep multiple times until a total time of has accumulated.

member.name: P:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.TableMappings
member.summary: Returns the mappings from types to tables that the connection currently understands.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.GetMapping(System.Type,SQLite.CreateFlags)
member.summary: Retrieves the mapping that is automatically generated for the given type.
member.param: The type whose mapping to the database is returned.
Optional flags allowing implicit PK and indexes based on naming conventions
member.returns: The mapping represents the schema of the columns of the database and contains methods to set and get properties of objects.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.GetMapping``1(SQLite.CreateFlags)
member.summary: Retrieves the mapping that is automatically generated for the given type.
member.param: Optional flags allowing implicit PK and indexes based on naming conventions
member.returns: The mapping represents the schema of the columns of the database and contains methods to set and get properties of objects.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.DropTable``1
member.summary: Executes a "drop table" on the database. This is non-recoverable.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.DropTable(SQLite.TableMapping)
member.summary: Executes a "drop table" on the database. This is non-recoverable.
member.param: The TableMapping used to identify the table.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.CreateTable``1(SQLite.CreateFlags)
member.summary: Executes a "create table if not exists" on the database. It also creates any specified indexes on the columns of the table. It uses a schema automatically generated from the specified type. You can later access this schema by calling GetMapping.
member.returns: The number of entries added to the database schema.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.CreateTable(System.Type,SQLite.CreateFlags)
member.summary: Executes a "create table if not exists" on the database. It also creates any specified indexes on the columns of the table. It uses a schema automatically generated from the specified type. You can later access this schema by calling GetMapping.
member.param: Type to reflect to a database table.
Optional flags allowing implicit PK and indexes based on naming conventions.
member.returns: The number of entries added to the database schema.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.CreateIndex(System.String,System.String,System.String[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates an index for the specified table and columns.
member.param: Name of the index to create
Name of the database table
An array of column names to index
Whether the index should be unique

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.CreateIndex(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates an index for the specified table and column.
member.param: Name of the index to create
Name of the database table
Name of the column to index
Whether the index should be unique

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.CreateIndex(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates an index for the specified table and column.
member.param: Name of the database table
Name of the column to index
Whether the index should be unique

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.CreateIndex(System.String,System.String[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates an index for the specified table and columns.
member.param: Name of the database table
An array of column names to index
Whether the index should be unique

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.CreateIndex``1(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{``0,System.Object}},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates an index for the specified object property. e.g. CreateIndex<Client>(c => c.Name);
member.typeparam: Type to reflect to a database table.
member.param: Property to index
Whether the index should be unique

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.NewCommand
member.summary: Creates a new SQLiteCommand. Can be overridden to provide a sub-class.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.CreateCommand(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates a new SQLiteCommand given the command text with arguments. Place a '?' in the command text for each of the arguments.
member.param: The fully escaped SQL.
Arguments to substitute for the occurences of '?' in the command text.
member.returns: A

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.Execute(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates a SQLiteCommand given the command text (SQL) with arguments. Place a '?' in the command text for each of the arguments and then executes that command. Use this method instead of Query when you don't expect rows back. Such cases include INSERTs, UPDATEs, and DELETEs. You can set the Trace or TimeExecution properties of the connection to profile execution.
member.param: The fully escaped SQL.
Arguments to substitute for the occurences of '?' in the query.
member.returns: The number of rows modified in the database as a result of this execution.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.Query``1(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates a SQLiteCommand given the command text (SQL) with arguments. Place a '?' in the command text for each of the arguments and then executes that command. It returns each row of the result using the mapping automatically generated for the given type.
member.param: The fully escaped SQL.
Arguments to substitute for the occurences of '?' in the query.
member.returns: An enumerable with one result for each row returned by the query.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.DeferredQuery``1(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates a SQLiteCommand given the command text (SQL) with arguments. Place a '?' in the command text for each of the arguments and then executes that command. It returns each row of the result using the mapping automatically generated for the given type.
member.param: The fully escaped SQL.
Arguments to substitute for the occurences of '?' in the query.
member.returns: An enumerable with one result for each row returned by the query. The enumerator will call sqlite3_step on each call to MoveNext, so the database connection must remain open for the lifetime of the enumerator.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.Query(SQLite.TableMapping,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates a SQLiteCommand given the command text (SQL) with arguments. Place a '?' in the command text for each of the arguments and then executes that command. It returns each row of the result using the specified mapping. This function is only used by libraries in order to query the database via introspection. It is normally not used.
member.param: A to use to convert the resulting rows into objects.
The fully escaped SQL.
Arguments to substitute for the occurences of '?' in the query.
member.returns: An enumerable with one result for each row returned by the query.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.DeferredQuery(SQLite.TableMapping,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates a SQLiteCommand given the command text (SQL) with arguments. Place a '?' in the command text for each of the arguments and then executes that command. It returns each row of the result using the specified mapping. This function is only used by libraries in order to query the database via introspection. It is normally not used.
member.param: A to use to convert the resulting rows into objects.
The fully escaped SQL.
Arguments to substitute for the occurences of '?' in the query.
member.returns: An enumerable with one result for each row returned by the query. The enumerator will call sqlite3_step on each call to MoveNext, so the database connection must remain open for the lifetime of the enumerator.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.Table``1
member.summary: Returns a queryable interface to the table represented by the given type.
member.returns: A queryable object that is able to translate Where, OrderBy, and Take queries into native SQL.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.Get``1(System.Object)
member.summary: Attempts to retrieve an object with the given primary key from the table associated with the specified type. Use of this method requires that the given type have a designated PrimaryKey (using the PrimaryKeyAttribute).
member.param: The primary key.
member.returns: The object with the given primary key. Throws a not found exception if the object is not found.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.Get(System.Object,SQLite.TableMapping)
member.summary: Attempts to retrieve an object with the given primary key from the table associated with the specified type. Use of this method requires that the given type have a designated PrimaryKey (using the PrimaryKeyAttribute).
member.param: The primary key.
The TableMapping used to identify the table.
member.returns: The object with the given primary key. Throws a not found exception if the object is not found.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.Get``1(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{``0,System.Boolean}})
member.summary: Attempts to retrieve the first object that matches the predicate from the table associated with the specified type.
member.param: A predicate for which object to find.
member.returns: The object that matches the given predicate. Throws a not found exception if the object is not found.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.Find``1(System.Object)
member.summary: Attempts to retrieve an object with the given primary key from the table associated with the specified type. Use of this method requires that the given type have a designated PrimaryKey (using the PrimaryKeyAttribute).
member.param: The primary key.
member.returns: The object with the given primary key or null if the object is not found.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.Find(System.Object,SQLite.TableMapping)
member.summary: Attempts to retrieve an object with the given primary key from the table associated with the specified type. Use of this method requires that the given type have a designated PrimaryKey (using the PrimaryKeyAttribute).
member.param: The primary key.
The TableMapping used to identify the table.
member.returns: The object with the given primary key or null if the object is not found.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.Find``1(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{``0,System.Boolean}})
member.summary: Attempts to retrieve the first object that matches the predicate from the table associated with the specified type.
member.param: A predicate for which object to find.
member.returns: The object that matches the given predicate or null if the object is not found.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.FindWithQuery``1(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Attempts to retrieve the first object that matches the query from the table associated with the specified type.
member.param: The fully escaped SQL.
Arguments to substitute for the occurences of '?' in the query.
member.returns: The object that matches the given predicate or null if the object is not found.

member.param: The TableMapping used to identify the table.
The fully escaped SQL.
Arguments to substitute for the occurences of '?' in the query.
member.returns: The object that matches the given predicate or null if the object is not found.

member.name: P:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.IsInTransaction
member.summary: Whether has been called and the database is waiting for a .

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.BeginTransaction
member.summary: Begins a new transaction. Call to end the transaction.
member.example: Throws if a transaction has already begun.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.SaveTransactionPoint
member.summary:
Creates a savepoint in the database at the current point in the transaction timeline. Begins a new transaction if one is not in progress.
Call to undo transactions since the returned savepoint. Call to commit transactions after the savepoint returned here. Call to end the transaction, committing all changes.
member.returns: A string naming the savepoint.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.Rollback
member.summary: Rolls back the transaction that was begun by or .

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.RollbackTo(System.String)
member.summary: Rolls back the savepoint created by or SaveTransactionPoint.
member.param: The name of the savepoint to roll back to, as returned by . If savepoint is null or empty, this method is equivalent to a call to

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.RollbackTo(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Rolls back the transaction that was begun by .
member.param: The name of the savepoint to roll back to, as returned by . If savepoint is null or empty, this method is equivalent to a call to
true to avoid throwing exceptions, false otherwise

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.Release(System.String)
member.summary:
Releases a savepoint returned from . Releasing a savepoint makes changes since that savepoint permanent if the savepoint began the transaction, or otherwise the changes are permanent pending a call to .
The RELEASE command is like a COMMIT for a SAVEPOINT.
member.param: The name of the savepoint to release. The string should be the result of a call to

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.Commit
member.summary: Commits the transaction that was begun by .

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.RunInTransaction(System.Action)
member.summary: Executes within a (possibly nested) transaction by wrapping it in a SAVEPOINT. If an exception occurs the whole transaction is rolled back, not just the current savepoint. The exception is rethrown.
member.param: The to perform within a transaction. can contain any number of operations on the connection but should never call or .

member.summary: Inserts all specified objects.
member.param:
An of the objects to insert.
A boolean indicating if the inserts should be wrapped in a transaction.
member.returns: The number of rows added to the table.

member.summary: Inserts all specified objects.

Literal SQL code that gets placed into the command. INSERT {extra} INTO ...
A boolean indicating if the inserts should be wrapped in a transaction.

member.returns: The number of rows added to the table.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.InsertOrReplace(System.Object)
member.summary: Inserts the given object and retrieves its auto incremented primary key if it has one. If a UNIQUE constraint violation occurs with some pre-existing object, this function deletes the old object.
member.param: The object to insert.
member.returns: The number of rows modified.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.Update(System.Object)
member.summary: Updates all of the columns of a table using the specified object except for its primary key. The object is required to have a primary key.
member.param: The object to update. It must have a primary key designated using the PrimaryKeyAttribute.
member.returns: The number of rows updated.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.Update(System.Object,System.Type)
member.summary: Updates all of the columns of a table using the specified object except for its primary key. The object is required to have a primary key.
member.param: The object to update. It must have a primary key designated using the PrimaryKeyAttribute.
The type of object to insert.
member.returns: The number of rows updated.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.UpdateAll(System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Updates all specified objects.
member.param: An of the objects to insert.
A boolean indicating if the inserts should be wrapped in a transaction
member.returns: The number of rows modified.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.Delete(System.Object)
member.summary: Deletes the given object from the database using its primary key.
member.param: The object to delete. It must have a primary key designated using the PrimaryKeyAttribute.
member.returns: The number of rows deleted.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.Delete``1(System.Object)
member.summary: Deletes the object with the specified primary key.
member.param: The primary key of the object to delete.
member.returns: The number of objects deleted.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.Delete(System.Object,SQLite.TableMapping)
member.summary: Deletes the object with the specified primary key.
member.param: The primary key of the object to delete.
The TableMapping used to identify the table.
member.returns: The number of objects deleted.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.DeleteAll``1
member.summary: Deletes all the objects from the specified table. WARNING WARNING: Let me repeat. It deletes ALL the objects from the specified table. Do you really want to do that?
member.returns: The number of objects deleted.
member.typeparam: The type of objects to delete.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.DeleteAll(SQLite.TableMapping)
member.summary: Deletes all the objects from the specified table. WARNING WARNING: Let me repeat. It deletes ALL the objects from the specified table. Do you really want to do that?
member.param: The TableMapping used to identify the table.
member.returns: The number of objects deleted.

member.name: T:SQLite.SQLiteConnectionString
member.summary: Represents a parsed connection string.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteCommand.OnInstanceCreated(System.Object)
member.summary: Invoked every time an instance is loaded from the database.
member.param: The newly created object.
member.remarks:
This can be overridden in combination with the method to hook into the life-cycle of objects.
Type safety is not possible because MonoTouch does not support virtual generic methods.

member.summary: Since the insert never changed, we only need to prepare once.

member.name: P:SQLite.SQLiteConnectionPool.Shared
member.summary: Gets the singleton instance of the connection tool.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnectionPool.Reset
member.summary: Closes all connections managed by this pool.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnectionPool.ApplicationSuspended
member.summary: Call this method when the application is suspended.
member.remarks: Behaviour here is to close any open connections.
